[File: aptos-core/api/src/context.rs] [Function: get_resources_by_pagination()] [Resource group expansion] When expanding ResourceGroup, does the function properly validate that all nested resources belong to the same account, preventing cross-account resource leakage? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/context.rs] [Function: get_resources_by_pagination()] [Limit overflow] Can an attacker provide limit + 1 items check to trigger integer overflow when calculating the pagination window? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/context.rs] [Function: get_resources_by_pagination()] [State key inconsistency] The function logs errors for inconsistent keys but continues - can this hide critical state corruption that should halt the API? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/context.rs] [Function: get_resources_by_pagination()] [BCS deserialization of ResourceGroup] If bcs::from_bytes::<ResourceGroup> fails, does it properly prevent partial resource exposure from corrupted state? (High)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/context.rs] [Function: get_resources_by_pagination()] [Converter is_resource_group race] Can the converter.is_resource_group() check race with concurrent state updates that change whether a StructTag is a resource group? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/context.rs] [Function: get_resources_by_pagination()] [Next key calculation] Does the next_key calculation properly handle the case where resources are added/removed during pagination, causing items to be skipped or duplicated? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/context.rs] [Function: get_modules_by_pagination()] [Code module enumeration] Does the function restrict enumeration of system modules at protected addresses that should not be publicly listable? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/context.rs] [Function: get_modules_by_pagination()] [Module bytecode size] Can requesting pagination of accounts with extremely large modules cause memory exhaustion? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/context.rs] [Function: get_modules_by_pagination()] [StateKey::module_id error handling] If StateKey::module_id() returns an error, does next_key become None, potentially hiding remaining modules? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/context.rs] [Function: get_block_by_height()] [Height boundary] Can requesting block at height == oldest_block_height exactly (not <) trigger off-by-one errors in pruning logic? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/context.rs] [Function: get_block_by_height()] [Block info race] Is there a race where get_block_info_by_height succeeds but the block gets pruned before get_block() reads transactions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/context.rs] [Function: get_block_by_version()] [Version pruning check] The function checks version < oldest_ledger_version, but does it handle the case where version is being pruned concurrently? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/context.rs] [Function: get_block()] [Future block detection] The check last_version > ledger_version prevents future blocks, but can race conditions allow accessing uncommitted blocks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/context.rs] [Function: get_block()] [Block hash parsing] If new_block_event.hash() fails to parse, does it leak information about internal block structure in the error message? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/context.rs] [Function: get_block()] [Transaction page size] The function limits transactions to max_block_transactions_page_size - can an attacker exploit this to hide transactions by requesting blocks with more transactions? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/context.rs] [Function: get_block()] [Partial block exposure] If with_transactions is true but get_transactions fails partway, does the function return partial block data that could confuse clients? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/context.rs] [Function: render_transactions_sequential()] [Timestamp monotonicity] The function updates timestamp only for block metadata - can non-block-metadata transactions have incorrect timestamps from stale values? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/context.rs] [Function: render_transactions_sequential()] [Converter consistency] Does the converter use latest_state_view which may be ahead of the transactions being rendered, causing anachronistic resource interpretations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/context.rs] [Function: render_transactions_sequential()] [Empty data handling] The function returns early for empty data, but does it properly signal whether this is due to no transactions or an error? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/context.rs] [Function: render_transactions_non_sequential()] [Block timestamp lookup] Each transaction does db.get_block_timestamp(t.version) - can this cause massive performance degradation or timeout attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/context.rs] [Function: render_transactions_non_sequential()] [Timestamp inconsistency] Can get_block_timestamp return inconsistent timestamps for transactions in the same block due to concurrent block updates? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/context.rs] [Function: render_transaction_summaries()] [Replay protector conversion] Does the conversion from aptos_types::transaction::ReplayProtector to API ReplayProtector handle all enum variants safely? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/context.rs] [Function: render_transaction_summaries()] [Transaction hash integrity] Are transaction_hash values cryptographically verified, or can corrupted DB state cause hash mismatches? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/context.rs] [Function: get_transactions()] [Start version validation] If txn_start_version != start_version, it errors, but can this hide situations where DB returned wrong data? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/context.rs] [Function: get_transactions()] [Proof verification] The function gets transactions_and_outputs with proof but doesn't verify the proof - can malicious DB return invalid transactions? (Critical)
